metadata.title: CVE-2020-27845 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
There's a flaw in src/lib/openjp2/pi.c of openjpeg in versions prior to2.4.0. If an attacker is able to provide untrusted input to openjpeg'sconversion/encoding functionality, they could cause an out-of-bounds read.The highest impact of this flaw is to application availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1').
insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
qtwebengine-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
texmaker: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
ghostscript package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14').
